# Welcome Everyone! {.smaller}

Welcome to the October event hosted by the `R-Ladies Rome chapter`.

I'm `Federica Gazzelloni`, one of the chapter's organizers, and I'm absolutely delighted to have each and every one of you here with us tonight.

It brings me great joy to introduce you to `Francesca Picone`, our newest co-organizer, Statistician, and Actuary with a rich background in data analysis and risk management. Francesca's expertise it is a valuable addition to our team.


# What is R-Ladies? {.smaller}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   `R-Ladies` is a global organization with the mission of promoting the R language and for empowering women at all user levels by building a collaborative global network.
-   It is a gender diversity friendly community founded in 2012 by [Gabriela de Queiroz](https://rladies.org/united-states-rladies/name/gabriela-de-queiroz/) in San Francisco.
-   `R-Ladies` is now a **world-wide organization** with 219 chapters in 63 countries, 3943 events and more than 93,000 members globally.

For more information, please visit [rladies.org](rladies.org)
:::

## R-Ladies {.smaller}

::: panel-tabset
### R-Ladies Rome

> **`R-Ladies Rome`** is a local chapter of **`R-Ladies Global`** dedicated to promoting gender diversity in the R language community. Our monthly meetings provide a platform to discuss current trends and **hot topics in R**, and we encourage active participation and engagement from all attendees. We welcome your suggestions and comments, and invite you to get in touch to join our vibrant community.

Organizers and Volunteers:

`Founder` of the chapter is [Claudia

# Taday's Event {.smaller}

Welcome to this event dedicated to exploring the world of `Career and Development` in Data Science, Statistics, and STEM fields, in general.  

We would like to hear about your individual career journeys, the challenges you've encountered, and the valuable experiences you've gained. Most importantly, we would like you to share your insights into the world of data science, statistics, and R programming from the perspective of women in science.

By sharing our stories and experiences, we can all learn from one another and gain a deeper understanding of the exciting paths that await us in these fields.
